result.execSummary:
The defendant Lakesha N Briggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: No objection to early term of prob after 12 mo if def successfully completes Diversion Drug Treatment Court & agent recommends to crt in writing.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. Pd by bail
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Def to successfully complete & participate in Drug Diversion Treatment Court.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Stayed for use as sanctions by Diversion Drug Crt.

Defendant appeared.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.

- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 10 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500 per case on the condition that the Def reports to and complies with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The Def shall report to DCBM by 10:00 am on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the Def fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the Def's arrest and the Def shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
